target.name: help
target.echo: OEPE MAF for Android command-line builder help
The command-line builder supports the following commands and options:
ant build -- Builds project artifacts including Java files, FARs and XLIFF
ant deploy -- Takes the result of the build command-line and deploys it to
a simulator or device (see options below).
ant clean -- Removes build artifacts created during previous builds. This
includes runtime staging, user artifacts and third-party fars.
Only artifacts under a target's build hierarchy are removed.

target.name: build
target.description: Performs all the step to build the application. If this target succeeds, then the android build (bin) directory is in a valid state to package the application for distribution or deployment.

target.name: package
target.description: Collects the result of running the build target into an unsigned apk file. This apk file will still need to be signed for distribution or deployment

target.name: sign
target.description: Signs the currently built apk file. The build and package steps are not dependencies of this target, so this may fail if run against an unbuilt target

target.name: dist
target.description: Called after build, this target produces a signed apk of the application in the mode and profile requested (i.e. debug vs. release)

target.name: deploy
target.description: Called after build, this target creates an apk for the application and tries to install on it on the configured simulator or device.
